result.execSummary:
The defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs , fees  and surcharges by 12-9-16 or, if not paid, serve 20  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.

01-25-16/ Judge John Siefert
The Court ordered the privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15.  Court objects to ES.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
20 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING
Reflects 01-25-16 Court order cancelling release privileges

Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
CANCELLATION OF HUBER / WORK RELEASE / ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE PRIVILEGES PURSUANT TO WISCONSIN STATUTES SECTION 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Siefert, Br 47, for review.  jm

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statment by Kizzy G.  

 The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15.  Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs , fees  and surcharges by 12-9-16 or, if not paid, serve 20  days in the House of Correction consecutive  to any sentence. 

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson in court with attorney  F. Araiza for  Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Latera B. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.47.vb

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.

Defendant Andriel Demetrius Jackson not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
